step1.sentence: She's still on the fence about whether to accept the job offer in another city.

step2.story: Mark had been on the fence about buying a new car for months. His old one was reliable enough, but a shiny new model kept catching his eye at the dealership. One morning, when it refused to start in the rain, the decision was finally made for him.

step3.story: When the town council proposed building a new shopping mall on the edge of the forest, residents were deeply divided. Sarah had always been on the fence about development projects — she valued progress but also loved the quiet trails where she walked her dog every evening. She attended the community meeting hoping to hear something that would tip her one way or the other. The developers promised jobs and tax revenue; the environmentalists warned of lost habitat and increased traffic. After two hours of passionate debate, Sarah left still on the fence, her mind heavy with competing images of the future. It wasn't until she watched her daughter chase fireflies in that forest at dusk that her heart finally made up what her head could not.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 울타리 위에 앉아 있다는 뜻으로, 어느 쪽에도 내려서지 않은 상태를 나타낸다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 어떤 결정이나 문제에 대해 찬성도 반대도 아닌 중립적인 입장을 취하거나, 아직 결정을 내리지 못하고 있을 때 사용한다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 19세기 미국에서 유래한 표현으로, 농장 울타리 위에 앉아 자신의 땅 어느 쪽에도 서지 않는 모습에서 비롯되었다. 정치적 중립을 표현하는 데 자주 쓰이다가 일반적인 우유부단함을 나타내는 표현으로 확장되었다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순한 중립보다는 결정을 미루고 있거나 양쪽 의견을 모두 고려 중인 상태를 강조하며, 때로는 소신 없이 눈치를 보는 부정적인 뉘앙스로도 쓰인다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: He's been on the fence about the proposal all week.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그는 일주일 내내 그 제안에 대해 중립적인 입장을 유지하고 있다.
